content.p: The School of Sociology and Social Policy offers a range of masters programmes taught by experts within their respective fields. Our programmes attract graduates from all around the world, contributing to a multicultural research and learning culture that makes the school a vibrant place to study. Each programme is highly specialised and strongly linked to the school's research interests. Our guide to applying Funding information Alumni profiles Staff profiles On our Criminology and Criminal Justice MA you'll develop a critical understanding of crime, criminalisation, victimisation, and criminal justice practice. On our Global Social and Public Policy MA youâ€™ll learn how policy decisions affect key global issues around inequality, migration, and social justice. We offer pre-sessional English language courses to improve your language level to meet the entry requirements for your degree. There is continued support while you study with us, with courses, consultations and drop-ins available. English language support Discover campus life with 360 degree images and videos on our virtual tour. Experience student life by exploring areas such as accommodation, student services, sport centres, libraries and the Researcher Academy.
